hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: Could you give me some smaller notes? shatavari kalpa amazon Just as a point of interest, the British National Corpus (BNC) shows "forums" occurring 110 times in the 100 million word sample with "fora" at 25. Of those 25, 6 used the word to refer to a specific building (e.g. a "fora" in Rome). The Corpus of Contemporary American English (COCA, 450 million word sample) has "forums" as 1,759 times and "fora" as 247. As you can see, this is proportionally much bigger. (Actually, the COCA sample includes "fora" instances that are colloquialisms of "for a" so the gap is even bigger.
